description.narrative:
Maintaining a Resilient Zero in Kono District: Investing in Infection Prevention and Control and Environmental Health in Priority Health Facilities.
To provide ongoing support to Koidu Government Hospital and Wellbody Clinic’s Environmental Health Teams in order to bolster their core Infection Prevention and Control functions and ultimately reduce the risk of another Ebola outbreak

This grant will provide ongoing staffing support of Koidu Government Hospital (KGH) and Wellbody Clinic's Environmental Health Teams (EHT) to conduct key infection, prevention and control functions (IPC), which help reduce the risk of another Ebola epidemic and support the maintenance of a resilient zero.
A majority of the KGH and Wellbody EHT staff are Ebola survivors, most of whom lost their livelihoods during the outbreak. PIH has chosen to hire survivors on their staff in order to address this challenge. The grant will support this vulnerable population, whose ongoing needs not only include livelihoods support, but also primary and secondary health care access, specialized health care services for a range of health challenges, and reintegration and psycho-social assistance.
